result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey L Small was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  No violent contact with victim, physical or verbal.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Arraignment at 09-24-2015 09:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:***MODIFIED 9/17/15 TO ALLOW NO VIOLENT CONTACT W/AMS AND THE MINOR CHILDREN***  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim, AMS and the minor children (person, property, residence or family). No contact w/Experience Fitness Center locations and employees.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Casey L Small in court with attorney Mark Francis Nielsen.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense and State stipulate to bond condition modification to allow no violent contact w/the victim. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond conditions are modified to allow no violent contact w/AMS and the minor children. All other conditions remain.  Arraignment scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
ATTY Nielsen
ATTY Nielsen files motion to dismiss counts one and two.
